s.text: The Journal waits until the 31st paragraph to mention that Pfizer's chairman sits on the board of the paper's parent company, Dow Jones.
The Post fronts George W. Bush's poor performance in a foreign-policy pop quiz.

The plan will dovetail White House ideas, such as tax credits for banks that lend to poor neighborhoods, and House GOP ideas, such as the elimination of capital gains taxes on property sales in these "renewal communities."

"If you say, Well, it would make me miserable, make my wife cry, but it has no innuendo, no unattributed pejorative remarks, no slap in the face for joy of slapping, it is news, not gutter gossip, and as a reporter I know the writer was fair, then give it to the copy desk."

The Journal 's online edition reports that early this morning the board of Warner-Lambert--which already makes the anti-cholesterol drug Lipton in partnership with Pfizer--opposed the Pfizer bid.
The Journal waits until the 31st paragraph to mention that Pfizer's chairman sits on the board of the paper's parent company, Dow Jones.
